summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys discussing compliance of Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement with a prior non-prosecution agreement. It includes a notification letter from a federal prosecutor stating the plea agreement is not in compliance, and subsequent attorney correspondence confirming that after discussion, it is deemed compliant.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Attorney corresponding about the compliance of Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement with a non-prosecution agreement. He confirms agreement after a telephone conference.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Attorney copied on the notification letter from the Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding non-compliance of Epstein's plea agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the non-prosecution agreement and state plea agreement being discussed for compliance.

connections.description: Goldberger is corresponding about the compliance of Epstein's plea agreement, indicating a legal representation relationship.
Black is copied on legal correspondence regarding Epstein's plea agreement, suggesting involvement in his legal defense.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement Execution
events.description: A non-prosecution agreement was entered into between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Plea Agreement
events.description: A telephone conference was held at 6:30 pm to discuss the compliance of Epstein's state plea agreement with the prior non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Notification of Non-Compliance
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sent a notification letter stating that Epstein's proposed state plea agreement was not in compliance with the non-prosecution agreement.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: A non-prosecution agreement between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida was executed in September 2007.
In June 2008, a federal prosecutor notified Epstein's attorneys that his proposed state plea agreement was not in compliance with the prior non-prosecution agreement.
After discussion, Epstein's attorney Jack Goldberger confirmed the state plea agreement was deemed compliant with the non-prosecution agreement.
The correspondence reveals legal negotiations and potential tensions between state and federal agreements in Epstein's case.
